Those platforms all offer a tangible service that is being used by millions of real world users, unlike Bitcoin. Furthermore, they have since become more energy efficient through centralization. Decentralized PoW can't do that.

*This doesn't imply I hate Bitcoin or Proof of Work coins, by the way - it's just important the industry reflects on itself and is critical of how many ice caps are worth melting for digital kittens. Don't bury your head in the sand simply because you hold some cryptocurrency.

Bitcoin mining is literally a few large companies competing over who can spend the most $$$ burning electricity. All PoW-based consensus with profit potential leads to this eventuality. Anyone telling you otherwise is selling snake oil.pic.twitter.com/w8UgurOqJy

This doesn't even factor in mining of other PoW currencies such as Ethereum, Zcash etc. The energy consumption numbers are even higher. Yes, I know we waste electricity on all sorts of other pointless things too... but why contribute to *more* waste?https://twitter.com/el33th4xor/status/997185825078202375 …
Cost to mine Bitcoin is about $4.5B, which is comparable to the cost of running one top 10 bank or payment processor.

As it should be. If you want reversible create a Bitcoin bank on top of it and you have Mt. Gox. But then you lose it’s key innovation - owning & spending your own money with no censorship. That is why it’s different. You are looking for a bigger candle rather than electricity.
Looking at your profile I think you are analysing $ BTC from the $ XRP perspective. # Bitcoin is about owning and spending your own money not about fast centralized database payments.

Yes. You have to move your money into another asset class to increase purchasing power. Bitcoin supply is fixed so as long as the utility increases over the long term it rewards the Bitcoin saver increasing their purchasing power for long term savers. It’s deflationary design.

Take some time to learn why it’s captured the imagination of so many. Own your own money, spend your own money and enter an economy based upon savings rather than debt. My gratitude to all that brought # Bitcoin to the world https://youtu.be/ukwLmxlJfR4 pic.twitter.com/Q9iVFoV6UK
